p: The separation of the polar lipid classes obtained from olive oil was carried out by high-performance liquid chromatography (HPLC) coupled to different detectors, as ultraviolet detectors (HPLC-UV) [ 20] or mass spectrometers (HPLC-MS) [ 12, 16, 19]. The structural characterization of the polar lipid molecules, namely the polar head and fatty acyl composition, has been achieved by using tandem MS (HPLC-MS/MS in [ 12, 16, 19] and NACE-MS/MS in [ 17]).
